title: UC_0001_1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent followed by purification on RNeasy micro columns (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers recommendations
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions.
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.

The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

title: UC_0400_1b.RNA.e1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent followed by purification on RNeasy micro columns (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers recommendations
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions.
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.

title: UC_0456_2.RNA.e1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent followed by purification on RNeasy micro columns (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers recommendations
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions.
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.

title: UC_0507_1.RNA.e1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent followed by purification on RNeasy micro columns (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers recommendations
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions.
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.

treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Prior to extraction a piece of the tumor was placed in RNAlater ICE (Ambion) overnight. Frozen biopsies were disrupted and homogenized using the tissuelyser system (Qiagen) and the Qiashredder homogenizer (Qiagen) respectively. The Allprep DNA/RNA Mini Kit (Qiagen) was used for RNA extraction. RNeasy columns were treated with DNAse I (RNase-Free DNase Set, Qiagen).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

title: UC_0580_1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Prior to extraction a piece of the tumor was placed in RNAlater ICE (Ambion) overnight. Frozen biopsies were disrupted and homogenized using the tissuelyser system (Qiagen) and the Qiashredder homogenizer (Qiagen) respectively. The Allprep DNA/RNA Mini Kit (Qiagen) was used for RNA extraction. RNeasy columns were treated with DNAse I (RNase-Free DNase Set, Qiagen).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

title: UC_0704_1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Prior to extraction a piece of the tumor was placed in RNAlater ICE (Ambion) overnight. Frozen biopsies were disrupted and homogenized using the tissuelyser system (Qiagen) and the Qiashredder homogenizer (Qiagen) respectively. The Allprep DNA/RNA Mini Kit (Qiagen) was used for RNA extraction. RNeasy columns were treated with DNAse I (RNase-Free DNase Set, Qiagen).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.

data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

title: UC_0762_1.a1.lbe1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Urothelial carcinoma samples were collected by cold-cup biopsy from the exophytic part of the bladder tumor of patients undergoing transurethral resection at hospitals within the southern healthcare region of Sweden.
extract_protocol_ch1: Prior to extraction a piece of the tumor was placed in RNAlater ICE (Ambion) overnight. Frozen biopsies were disrupted and homogenized using the tissuelyser system (Qiagen) and the Qiashredder homogenizer (Qiagen) respectively. The Allprep DNA/RNA Mini Kit (Qiagen) was used for RNA extraction. RNeasy columns were treated with DNAse I (RNase-Free DNase Set, Qiagen).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.

data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.

Frozen biopsies were disrupted and homogenized using the tissuelyser system (Qiagen) and the Qiashredder homogenizer (Qiagen) respectively. The Allprep DNA/RNA Mini Kit (Qiagen) was used for RNA extraction. RNeasy columns were treated with DNAse I (RNase-Free DNase Set, Qiagen).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was labeled using the Illumina TotalPrep-96 RNA Amplification Kit (Ambion), following the manufacurers instructions. All purification steps  were performed using the Thermo Kingfisher Flex magnetic beads system (Fisher Scientific).
data_processing: Control probe filtering and background correction was performed within the BioArray Software Environment (BASE). The data was corrected for bias introduced by two different extraction methods (RNeasy and AllPrep)  by a probe-by-probe rescaling of each sample, determining the scaling factor using the median value of RNeasy samples vs the median value of AllPrep samples. The smaller sample group (AllPrep) was rescaled to the same median as the larger group (DNeasy). Using the same method, we rescaled all probes of labeling plates P1, P2, P5, and P6 to have the same median values as P4 samples, thereby correcting for an observed labeling plate bias. Following bias correction, the data was quantile normalized using the limma package (Smyth, Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol. 2004) and converted to the log2 scale. The probes were annotated to HGNC GeneSymbols using the Illumina platform annotation file and probes without gene symbol were discarded. Next, 50% of the probes with lowest intensity were discarded and the remaining probes were mean-centered. Probes annotated with the same gene symbol were merged using the median value for each gene symbol.
data_processing.1: Normalized data in Sample tables below: Original detection p-values, along with expression values arrived at after: background correction, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for extraction method, probe-by-probe rescaling adjustment for labeling plate, quantile normalization, Log2 conversion, application of a 50% intensity filter and mean centering of probes.
data_processing.2: Matrix non-normalized (linked as supplementary file on Series record): The raw intensity values subjected only to background correction.
